messages: ec0507fcc6cdf99d06e7b2a1e43788bd (07:20): Hi, anyone here who knows how to enable directory and file completion in pdksh?
b642a352cbc116a40b55e3e18e97e94d (07:20): set -o emacs
b642a352cbc116a40b55e3e18e97e94d (07:21): set -o vi may work too.
ec0507fcc6cdf99d06e7b2a1e43788bd (07:22): I have tried that, but pressing the TAB key, just makes a tabulator jump
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:22): coolzone: bind ^I=complete-list
b642a352cbc116a40b55e3e18e97e94d (07:23): Are you using the ksh that comes with NetBSD, or the one from pkgsrc?
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:23): Meta_Ridley: he's using pdksh he said, so he's using neither
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:23): (or is pkgsrc in pkgsrc, either?)
b642a352cbc116a40b55e3e18e97e94d (07:23): Actually, the pdksh *is* the one that NetBSD has installed by default.
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:24): Meta_Ridley: no, it's a heavyly patched pdksh
7d03c893d5e319aff7504f429cfca64a (07:24): No dont pull that out.
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:24): I would say that you can't even compare the one that comes with NetBSD and the original one. NetBSD's is way better.
ec0507fcc6cdf99d06e7b2a1e43788bd (07:24): Hmm, I just found out the "esc" key does the trick after using the "set -o vi"
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:24): coolzone: 04:20 < ciruz> coolzone: bind ^I=complete-list
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:24): then you can use tab
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:25): in emacs and in vi mode
b642a352cbc116a40b55e3e18e97e94d (07:25): I didn't know.
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:25): coolzone: but I don't think you'll have fun with an unpatched pdksh
ec0507fcc6cdf99d06e7b2a1e43788bd (07:25): ciruz, thanks! :-) can I set this up in .profile to its set up each time?
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:26): try mksh or so. it's the ksh that mirbsd uses, based on the openbsd ksh which is very near to the netbsd ksh
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:26): coolzone: yes, you can
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:26): coolzone: but be sure that you use ksh -l then
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:26): does ksh even have bash-style $PS1 stuffs?
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:27): mngrif: i don't know for the unpatched pdksh, but openbsd ksh / mksh has
ec0507fcc6cdf99d06e7b2a1e43788bd (07:27): cirus, I am sorry but what to you mean that I should use "ksh -l" then? Bear with me.
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:27): coolzone: .profile is only processed when you start a login shell
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:27): ciruz: where can i find documentation about it? the manpage only speaks of what PS1 is
ec0507fcc6cdf99d06e7b2a1e43788bd (07:28): ciruz, ahh ok :-) Thanks a lot!
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:28): mngrif: hm, don't know. i just looked at other's configs
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:28): i mean, you can PS1='`pwd`@`hostname`# '
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:28): but that's two programs that get executed every time you press enter!
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:29): mngrif: PS1='$PWD@`hostname`$ '
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:29): one less
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:29): HOSTNAME=`hostname`
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:29): PS1='$PWD@$HOSTNAME$ '
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:30): that works
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:30): awesome, thank you
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:30): you could even reduce it to one line:
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:30): PS1="\$PWD@`hostname`"
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:31): ooh, $PWD doesn't work properly
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:31): it does
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:31): 2cb# PS1="root@$PWD$ "
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:31): root@/root$ cd /
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:31): the \ is important if you use "
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:32): read the manpage and look what's the difference between ' and " ;)
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:32): yeah, that works
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:32): try this:
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:32): PS1="\$PWD@`hostname`"
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:32): i got it now, thank you
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:32): with this, hostname gets executed once
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:32): and $PWD parsed everytime you press enter
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:35): PS1="root@2cb:\$PWD$ "
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:35): is what i turned it into
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:35): you want PS1="root@`hostname`\$PWD\$ "
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:36): the second $ should be escaped and this way, you can change the hostname
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:36): the `hostname` gets only executed once. \`hostname\` would be executed every time
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:36): hostname isn't gonna get changed on this box
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:37): use it anyway. this way, you can simple scp your .profile on another machine and so on :)
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:37): s/simple/simply/
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:38): only netbsd box i have, it's mac68k, want a shell?
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:38): would be cool :)
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:39): use js or ciruz if that's okay with you
19692161f15c2684f1e415caafcdd77d (07:39): dun matter
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:39): (js preferred)
d53a0f4e01c590ce222b6a33a6d6ffd3 (07:40): thx in advance :)
